verses.verse: Now <S%H6583>Pashur<s%> the <S%H1121>son<s%> of <S%H564>Immer<s%> the <S%H3548>priest<s%>, who was also <S%H6496>chief<s%> <S%H5057>governor<s%> in the <S%H1004>house<s%> of the <S%H3068>LORD<s%>, <S%H8085>heard<s%> that <S%H3414>Jeremiah<s%> <S%H5012>prophesied<s%> these <S%H1697>things<s%>.

Then <S%H6583>Pashur<s%> <S%H5221>smote<s%> <S%H3414>Jeremiah<s%> the <S%H5030>prophet<s%>, and <S%H5414>put<s%> him in the <S%H4115>stocks<s%> that were in the <S%H5945>high<s%> <S%H8179>gate<s%> of <S%H1144>Benjamin<s%>, which was by the <S%H1004>house<s%> of the <S%H3068>LORD<s%>.

And it came to pass on the <S%H4283>morrow<s%>, that <S%H6583>Pashur<s%> brought <S%H3318>forth<s%> <S%H3414>Jeremiah<s%> out of the <S%H4115>stocks<s%>. Then <S%H559>said<s%> <S%H3414>Jeremiah<s%> unto him, The <S%H3068>LORD<s%> hath not <S%H7121>called<s%> thy <S%H8034>name<s%> <S%H6583>Pashur<s%>, but <S%H4036>Magor-missabib<s%>.

For thus <S%H559>saith<s%> the <S%H3068>LORD<s%>, Behold, I will <S%H5414>make<s%> thee a <S%H4032>terror<s%> to thyself, and to all thy <S%H157>friends<s%>: and they shall <S%H5307>fall<s%> by the <S%H2719>sword<s%> of their <S%H341>enemies<s%>, and thine <S%H5869>eyes<s%> shall <S%H7200>behold<s%> it: and I will <S%H5414>give<s%> all <S%H3063>Judah<s%> into the <S%H3027>hand<s%> of the <S%H4428>king<s%> of <S%H894>Babylon<s%>, and he shall carry them <S%H1540>captive<s%> into <S%H894>Babylon<s%>, and shall <S%H5221>slay<s%> them with the <S%H2719>sword<s%>.

Moreover I will <S%H5414>deliver<s%> all the <S%H2633>strength<s%> of this <S%H5892>city<s%>, and all the <S%H3018>labours<s%> thereof, and all the precious <S%H3366>things<s%> thereof, and all the <S%H214>treasures<s%> of the <S%H4428>kings<s%> of <S%H3063>Judah<s%> will I <S%H5414>give<s%> into the <S%H3027>hand<s%> of their <S%H341>enemies<s%>, which shall <S%H962>spoil<s%> them, and <S%H3947>take<s%> them, and <S%H935>carry<s%> them to <S%H894>Babylon<s%>.

And thou, <S%H6583>Pashur<s%>, and all that <S%H3427>dwell<s%> in thine <S%H1004>house<s%> shall <S%H3212>go<s%> into <S%H7628>captivity<s%>: and thou shalt <S%H935>come<s%> to <S%H894>Babylon<s%>, and there thou shalt <S%H4191>die<s%>, and shalt be <S%H6912>buried<s%> there, thou, and all thy <S%H157>friends<s%>, to whom thou hast <S%H5012>prophesied<s%> <S%H8267>lies<s%>.

¶ O <S%H3068>LORD<s%>, thou hast <S%H6601>deceived<s%> me, and I was <S%H6601>deceived<s%>: thou art <S%H2388>stronger<s%> than I, and hast <S%H3201>prevailed<s%>: I am in <S%H7814>derision<s%> <S%H3117>daily<s%>, every one <S%H3932>mocketh<s%> me.

For <S%H1767>since<s%> I <S%H1696>spake<s%>, I cried <S%H2199>out<s%>, I <S%H7121>cried<s%> <S%H2555>violence<s%> and <S%H7701>spoil<s%>; because the <S%H1697>word<s%> of the <S%H3068>LORD<s%> was made a <S%H2781>reproach<s%> unto me, and a <S%H7047>derision<s%>, <S%H3117>daily<s%>.

Then I <S%H559>said<s%>, I will not make <S%H2142>mention<s%> of him, nor <S%H1696>speak<s%> any more in his <S%H8034>name<s%>. But his word was in mine <S%H3820>heart<s%> as a <S%H1197>burning<s%> <S%H784>fire<s%> shut <S%H6113>up<s%> in my <S%H6106>bones<s%>, and I was <S%H3811>weary<s%> with <S%H3557>forbearing<s%>, and I <S%H3201>could<s%> not stay.

¶ For I <S%H8085>heard<s%> the <S%H1681>defaming<s%> of <S%H7227>many<s%>, <S%H4032>fear<s%> on every <S%H5439>side<s%>. <S%H5046>Report<s%>, say they, and we will <S%H5046>report<s%> it. All my <S%H582%H7965>familiars<s%> <S%H8104>watched<s%> for my <S%H6763%H6761>halting<s%>, saying, Peradventure he will be <S%H6601>enticed<s%>, and we shall <S%H3201>prevail<s%> against him, and we shall <S%H3947>take<s%> our <S%H5360>revenge<s%> on him.

But the <S%H3068>LORD<s%> is with me as a <S%H1368>mighty<s%> terrible <S%H6184>one<s%>: therefore my <S%H7291>persecutors<s%> shall <S%H3782>stumble<s%>, and they shall not <S%H3201>prevail<s%>: they shall be <S%H3966>greatly<s%> <S%H954>ashamed<s%>; for they shall not <S%H7919>prosper<s%>: their <S%H5769>everlasting<s%> <S%H3639>confusion<s%> shall never be <S%H7911>forgotten<s%>.

But, O <S%H3068>LORD<s%> of <S%H6635>hosts<s%>, that <S%H974>triest<s%> the <S%H6662>righteous<s%>, and <S%H7200>seest<s%> the <S%H3629>reins<s%> and the <S%H3820>heart<s%>, let me <S%H7200>see<s%> thy <S%H5360>vengeance<s%> on them: for unto thee have I <S%H1540>opened<s%> my <S%H7379>cause<s%>.

<S%H7891>Sing<s%> unto the <S%H3068>LORD<s%>, <S%H1984>praise<s%> ye the <S%H3068>LORD<s%>: for he hath <S%H5337>delivered<s%> the <S%H5315>soul<s%> of the <S%H34>poor<s%> from the <S%H3027>hand<s%> of <S%H7489>evildoers<s%>.
¶ <S%H779>Cursed<s%> be the <S%H3117>day<s%> wherein I was <S%H3205>born<s%>: let not the <S%H3117>day<s%> wherein my <S%H517>mother<s%> <S%H3205>bare<s%> me be <S%H1288>blessed<s%>.

<S%H779>Cursed<s%> be the <S%H376>man<s%> who brought <S%H1319>tidings<s%> to my <S%H1>father<s%>, <S%H559>saying<s%>, A <S%H2145>man<s%> <S%H1121>child<s%> is <S%H3205>born<s%> unto thee; making him <S%H8055>very<s%> <S%H8055>glad<s%>.

And let that <S%H376>man<s%> be as the <S%H5892>cities<s%> which the <S%H3068>LORD<s%> <S%H2015>overthrew<s%>, and <S%H5162>repented<s%> not: and let him <S%H8085>hear<s%> the <S%H2201>cry<s%> in the <S%H1242>morning<s%>, and the <S%H8643>shouting<s%> at <S%H6256%H6672>noontide<s%>;

Because he <S%H4191>slew<s%> me not from the <S%H7358>womb<s%>; or that my <S%H517>mother<s%> might have been my <S%H6913>grave<s%>, and her <S%H7358>womb<s%> to be <S%H5769>always<s%> <S%H2030>great<s%> with me.

Wherefore came I <S%H3318>forth<s%> out of the <S%H7358>womb<s%> to <S%H7200>see<s%> <S%H5999>labour<s%> and <S%H3015>sorrow<s%>, that my <S%H3117>days<s%> should be <S%H3615>consumed<s%> with <S%H1322>shame<s%>?
